## Paying Your I-901 SEVIS Fee

* * *

June 13, 2012

You must [pay the I-901 SEVIS fee](https://studyinthestates.dhs.gov/students/sevis-i-901-fee) if you decide that you want to study in the United States and [have received acceptance](https://studyinthestates.dhs.gov/students/accepted) to a Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP)-certified school. Paying the I-901 SEVIS fee is an important step in the process of applying for a student visa.

All prospective F and M students must pay the I-901 SEVIS fee to [apply for a visa](https://studyinthestates.dhs.gov/students/getting-a-visa) to enter the United States. If you are from a country that participates in the [Visa Waiver Program,](http://travel.state.gov/visa/temp/without/without_1990.html#countries "(opens in a new window)") you must still pay the fee before you enter the country.

If you are in the United States on a valid nonimmigrant visa for a purpose other than attending school, and you are [changing your status](https://studyinthestates.dhs.gov/students/change-of-status) to F or M, you must also pay the fee.

Additionally, you may need to pay the fee if you are applying for reinstatement of student status or if you have been out of the United States for more than five months.

If you are unsure whether you need to pay the I-901 fee again, talk with your designated school official before you apply to extend your student status, transfer to another school, receive authorization for [optional practical training,](https://studyinthestates.dhs.gov/resources/working) or receive a new visa for your current course of study.

To pay the I-901 SEVIS fee, go to [FMJfee.com](https://fmjfee.com/i901fee/index.html "(opens in a new window)"). Once you pay your fee, you must print your receipt from FMJfee.com. You will use it as proof of payment and you should take it with you to your visa appointment and when you travel to the United States.

If you have questions, you can call the SEVP Response Center at 703-603-3400. SEVP answers this number from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET, Monday through Friday. At other times, you may leave a message and an SEVP representative will return your call.
